result.execSummary:
The defendant Dustin A. Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Dustin A. Clark is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Dustin A. Clark was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Dustin A. Clark was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

3:41 p.m. Defendant Dustin A. Clark in court, in custody, via video. Defendant states he has been in custody since 9/12/16 - probation was revoked - Defendant statement to revocation case-did not know that Counts were going to be consecutive. Court reduces financial obligations in 15CF237 to civil judgment. Adj. 3:45 p.m.
revoked

4:50 p.m. Defendant Dustin A. Clark in court, via video, in custody.  Defendant states he was in custody, was in Koinonia and is now on PO hold - did not successfully complete Koinonia - Defendant states worked for a "little bit". As of today is unemployed. Adj. 4:56 p.m.  Review hearing scheduled for November 21, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Review hearing on September 12, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Dustin A. Clark
Current: 2000 Winnebago Drive, Inmate Oneida County Jail, Rhinelander, WI 54501 United States  (Effective: 09-25-2015)

PC from fiance - will be in this week to get set up on payment plan  - he is in carcerated - notified her she can fill out form on his behalf -
State's Exhibit 1 - original retained in Exhibit drawer

10:49 a.m. Defendant Dustin A. Clark in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Michlig statement to negotiations/resolution -  Voorhees objection to repeater charges - requests brief recess to deal with issue or that State provide proof of repeater status. Court takes judicial notice of Oneida County Case no. 14cf172. Voorhees statement that felony repeater statute does not include OWI. Michlig statement; has proof to provide to defense - Recess 10:57 a.m. On record 11:01 a.m. Voorhees - stipulates to proof of repeater allegations. Plea questionnaire filed. Court states that 939.(2)(3) excludes OWI conviction. State's Exhibit 1 marked (CCAP records) - Voorhees stipulates to Exhibit 1 - received - Court - Exhibit 1 is sufficient to establish repeater violations. States moves to dismiss Count 3 - Granted. Defendant pleads guilty to Counts 1 and 2.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty. Michlig/Voorhees/Victim A.L./Defendant/Court statement on sentencing.
Court Sentence
Count 1
Prison - Imposed and stayed - 2 years
 Initial Confinement - 18 months
 Extended Supervision -  6 months
Count 2 - consecutive to Count 1
Prison - Imposed and stayed - 2 years 
 Initial Confinement - 18 months 
 Extended Supervision - 6 months 
POP - 3 years
CC/DNA Surcharge/Domestic Abuse Surcharge/Supervision Fees
  Fine/Forfeiture/Court Costs are not a condition of probation and are to be paid in full directly to the Clerk of Court's Office within 60 daysor date provided by Court,  unless a payment plan has been approved and set up through the Clerk of Court's Office.
DNA
  The court informs defendant of right to request expungement of the DNA under Wis. Stat. 165.77(4).
No intoxicants; no taverns
Must follow after care treatment plan from Koinonia
Anger management counseling
Parenting class
Jail - 4 months with Huber for all purposes to commence on/or before Friday, March 4, 2016 at 4:00 p.m. If employed outside of Oneida County may serve in county of employment
Jail credit - 49 days if revoked
Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.

Appeal rights given.
Adj. 11:50 a.m.
from Voorhees - was sent to Br II  11-6 - never received by Clerk
May not reside with Angelica D. Lafferty but may have contact with Angelica D. Lafferty only with her consent - No intoxicants; no taverns.

3:13 p.m. Defendant Dustin A. Clark in court via video with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Dustin A. Clark in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in receipt of discharge summary from Koinonia - Court statement to bond - Court amends to $5,000 sig bond - nonmonetary conditions to remain in place. Voorhees in receipt of Information - waives further reading - enters not guilty plea to all counts. Bail continued. Adj. 3:18 p.m.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.
from treatment provider

9:05 a.m. Defendant Dustin A. Clark in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Dustin A. Clark in custody.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State calls ONSO Deputy Paul Blondhein/sworn/direct by State/ Witness ID's defendant / Voorhees cross - Court finds probable cause exists and binds defendant over. Voorhees motion to modify bail - presents letter from Koinonia - moves for no contact provision to be lifted and for money provisions be amended - Michlig statement to motion - Michlig stipulates to lifting no contact provision to discuss medical issues - Court questions Lafferty regarding no contact provision - Court does modifies bond defendant may not reside with Lafferty may however have contact with her with her consent. If the Court is presented with discharge summary showing  favorable progress during treatment and favorable prognosis - cash bond modification will be reconsidered. Adj. 9:31 a.m.  Arraignment scheduled for November 9, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
of no contact provision - face to face at Koinonia for one visit
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery
to modify bail

3:24 p.m. Defendant Dustin A. Clark in court, via video, with attorney John E Voorhees.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Schiek statement - SRT team has been called out - witness is on call - and not enough officers to bring defendant to courthouse - moves for adjournment of preliminary hearing - Granted. Voorhees files Motion to Modify Bond - Schiek has no objection - modify bond to permit defendant to be released for in patient ADOA treatment at Koinonia to be commenced on October 6, 2015 - in event of successful completion with staff approval - court would then consider granting request to modify to signature bond. Voorhees waives time limits for prelim. Other conditions of bond to be continued. If defendant is still in treatment at adjourned prelimin - Court has no objection to defendant attending hearing. Defendant questions Court regarding possibility of bringing paperwork from treatment center at time of prelim hearing. Court states paperwork may be provided or counselor may attend prelim for purpose of reporting on defendant's progress.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 09:00 am.
No contact with Angelica D. Lafferty. No intoxicants. No taverns.

1:19 p.m. Defendant Dustin A. Clark in court with attorney John E Voorhees.  Defendant Dustin A. Clark in custody.  Steven M. Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - not guilty plea Michlig/Voorhees statement to bail - Court sets $3,000 cash bond.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 03:15 pm. Adj. 01:24 p.m.
